title: TAY Services Case Manager
location: San Francisco, CA 94107 (South Of Market area)
summary: STRONG COMMUNICATION SKILLS – Exceptional oral and written communication skills including the demonstrated ability to research, assimilate, and analyze…
description:
Position Title: Transitional Age Youth (TAY) Services Case Manager
Reports To: Program Manager
Status: Full-Time
FLSA Designation: Non -Exempt
JOB SUMMARY: The Case Manager provides intensive, weekly case management for Transition Age Youth (TAY) living at single site affordable housing locations. Through comprehensive case management, the Case Manager helps youth to identify and attain goals in the areas of employment and education, self-sufficiency, health and wellness, relationships, professionalism and personal advocacy. The Case Manager also provides on-site, drop in resource and referral support for TAY residents as needed and coordinates TAY community building activities that promote independent living skills. This position works closely with Affordable Housing partners to ensure TAY housing stability.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Responsible for providing Case-management and career counseling to youth in program: Conduct one-hour weekly meetings with youth assigned to caseload to help participants identify and accomplish short and long-term goals Create and deliver impactful service plans for youth that focus on achieving outcomes in the areas of education, employment, long-term housing, parenting, relationships and overall health Coordinate with referral agencies, identify community resources, track participants’ progress, and develop creative ways for participants to practice and strengthen their independent living skills Prepare clients to maintain housing after program exit or help them to identify alternative housing options if necessary Assess educational status and interest of youth participants and support youth with their educational goals Work with youth to improve resumes and cover letters, submit job applications, prepare for interviews and secure full and part-time employment Coach youth participants on handling work-related issues, promote self-advocacy and increase success in job retention Form partnerships with community agencies that can help link youth with internships and employment opportunities

Create new linkages with community-based organizations, on-site resources and housing stability support through the case management process to help build youth transition to independent living. Help participants move into supported housing. This includes helping youth secure and transport furniture, shop for home necessities, and locate resources in their new community Ensure that apartments meet cleanliness standards by conducting monthly apartment inspections Display and disseminate community resources relevant to TAY residents and provide resource, referral and eviction prevention support to TAY residents as needed Client meetings scheduled as needed to ensure successful transition to independent living Support property management to address serious housing concerns related to TAY Guide tours for funders and community providers to demonstrate how First Place for Youth partnerships with Affordable Housing agencies provide TAY with a stable and affordable housing solution Coordinate community events and workshops to assist TAY with independent living skills Actively participate in weekly coordination meetings with property management staff and agency partners
Documentation/Administrative Duties Attend weekly program meetings, monthly agency staff meetings, and individual weekly supervision with Program Manager Maintain files for caseload and update monthly paperwork Ensure proper and timely documentation of services including written case notes Work collaboratively with colleagues across the organization and within respective department Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS and COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS: BA Social Welfare, Psychology, or equivalent required At least three years experience working with transition age or foster youth with complex presentations including presentations of chronic trauma. Must be comfortable working in community settings. Experience working with youth who have mental health and substance abuse issues and Experience in creating and delivering impactful service plans for participants Experience in youth development model, asset-based relationship building, and experience in motivating youth ,Strong clinical skills, and/or a desire to learn more about the effects of the child welfare system on the lives of youth and young adults Must be able to pass a Community Care Licensing background check ATTENTION TO DETAIL – Ability to work with high level of detail, work has high level of professional polish down to smallest details, documents and products are well thought out and clear, database is organized and up to date. DRIVEN BY ACCOMPLISHMENT – Clarity on project goals and the personal drive to accomplish goals, finished projects are thorough and delivered on time. High level of personal accountability for the quality and impact of work. COMPUTER SKILLS - Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications including MS Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint, Project and Outlook. Experience with database systems. STRONG COMMUNICATION SKILLS – Exceptional oral and written communication skills including the demonstrated ability to research, assimilate, and analyze information, compose engaging messages, and present data in a clear and inspiring manner. HIGH LEVEL OF PROFESSIONALISM – A high level of professionalism in work and interpersonal interactions with both internal and external contacts, presents to others as organized, informed, and friendly. DECISIVE NATURE - Well-honed ability to independently anticipate and analyze situations, define problems and objectives, recognize viable alternatives, and formulate rapid solutions, with understanding of the inherent risks and the implications of making tough decisions. AVAILABILITY for occasional evening and weekend work and some travel as needed.
Core Competencies - required of all staff for successful performance at First Place.
• RELENTLESS PURSUIT OF EXCELLENCE - Intentional use of data to improve performance · Possesses strong drive, initiative and motivation · Detail and results orientation • Demonstrates good work habits • Resiliency in persisting through setbacks · Demonstrated success, with the ability to think strategically while executing tactically within a resource-constrained environment.
• STRATEGIC THINKING - Seeks and utilizes resources to inform and contextualize own work · Thinks interdependently, framing the goals of one department/project within the entire vision • Synthesizes information to make astute recommendations and/or decisions • Prioritizes goals for success.
• INVESTMENT IN OTHERS - Creates an environment that maximizes the return on investment in others • Collaborates to set and achieve goals that comport with First Place’s mission, strategic plan and desired measurable outcomes • Creates and utilizes development opportunities to address individual needs and capacity to accomplish performance objectives • Creates and identifies opportunities for recognition of success • Provides supportive environment to learn from mistakes. EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION - Courageous, strategic, clear and direct communication that resolves discrepancies and overcomes challenges and obstacles to organizational success · Ability to respectfully ask questions, challenge, and communicate both positive and difficult messages to subordinates, superiors, peers and youth · Sound judgment regarding the appropriateness of guarding confidentiality to protect the privacy rights of colleagues or youth · Strong verbal and written communication skills.
• COURAGE - Asks questions in order to learn and encourage dialogue • Willing to make mistakes and to be accountable for own work • Speaks about issues truthfully and without blame • Leads by example, displaying behavior that respects the mission, youth and First Place • Holds high expectations for self, one another and for our youth.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 20 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.
Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: DIRECTOR OF DECISION SUPPORT & ANALYTICS
company: University of California Office of the President
summary: Excellent knowledge of relational database structure, programming concepts, external data sources, and experience working with complex data systems.
description:
Location: Oakland
Job ID: 14958

Job Posting


For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP


UC OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT

At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.

The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic health centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

University of California Health (UCH) comprises six academic health centers, 20 health professional schools, a Global Health Institute and systemwide services that improve the health of patients and the University's students, faculty and employees. All of UC's hospitals are ranked among the best in California and its medical schools and health professional schools are nationally ranked in their respective areas.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Director of Decision Support & Analytics plays an important role in forging connections between the UC Medical Centers and Practice Groups, the UC Health Data Warehouse, the health plan administrators and the Population Health and Quality team. This role focuses on providing data and analytics that will help ensure the success of our employee health plans where UC is taking financial risk. The plans include HMO, PPO, high deductible and Medicare benefit structures. Not only does UC strive to be a world leading provider of health care services, we also aspire to be a market leader in the financing mechanism for providing those services and creating a true collaboration with the UC Health provider community. The Director of Decision Support & Analytics will work closely with the self-insured health plan team within UC Health, to forge the next generation of health plan coverage with UC employees as the research and testing vehicle to get us there.

Responsibilities

25%

ANALYSIS Use strong analytical skills and work closely with the Chief Clinical Officer and Executive Director of Self-Insured Health Plans in analyzing and leveraging healthcare business datasets such as claims/encounter data, member data, utilization, eligibility, provider and pharmacy data to deliver meaningful insights and influence business decisions and strategies.


25%

FINANCIAL ANALYTICS Provide financial analysis and solutions to senior management audience, including key indicators, forecasting and look back analyses to determine whether initiatives had any impact; Develops cost containment and care delivery strategies and processes.


20%

RESEARCH Independently, or in conjunction with consultants and actuaries, performs highly complex financial or resource research and studies for both internal department and external constituents.


15%

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE Work independently and effectively as a key team member in a highly visible role where your business intelligence and analytical skills will apply to all areas of the self-funded employee health plans.


15%

OPERATIONS Improve efficiency, reduce costs and optimize operations as we endeavor to make data driven decisions.



Required Qualifications

Advanced analytical, problem solving, interpretation and reporting skills (e.g. using medical claims, pharmacy reporting and/or administrative data sets).
Superb communication skills in formulating and communicating accurate and precise data process, findings and recommendations via executive level reports and presentations.
Proficiency in Microsoft Applications and Suites, Windows Server, and Microsoft SQL databases is required (intermediate/advanced).
Excellent knowledge of relational database structure, programming concepts, external data sources, and experience working with complex data systems.
In-depth working knowledge of data warehouse/relational data base structures, which may include IBM Watson Database, IBM Cognos Software, Health Plan Database(s) and Reporting Tools.
Strong knowledge of the University environment including its infrastructure, goals, objectives, achievements, rules, regulations and policies.
Strong knowledge of health care delivery and related economics as well as basic working knowledge of clinical issues and practices.
Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in Public Health, Healthcare Economics, MBA and/or related field preferred.
Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in a related field is required.

SALARY AND BENEFITS

Salary: Salary commensurate with experience.

Benefits: For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit: Benefits of Belonging

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

HOW TO APPLY

Please be prepared to attach a cover letter and resume with your application.

APPLICATION REVIEW DATE

The first review date for this job is March 2, 2021. The position will be open until filled.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Background Check Process: Successful completion of a background check is required for this critical position. Background check process at UCOP

Smoke Free Work Environment: The University of California, Office of the President, is smoke & tobacco-free as of January 1, 2014. UC Smoke & Tobacco Free Policy

EEO STATEMENT

The University of California, Office of the President, is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. EEO/AA Employer UC Nondiscrimination Policy

The University of California, Office of the President, strives to make this job board accessible to any and all users. If you have comments regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at: Accessibility or email the Human Resource Department at: epost@ucop.edu.

LI-SG1

To apply, visit https://careerspub.universityofcalifornia.edu/psp/ucop/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_APP_SCHJOB.GBL?Page=HRS_APP_JBPST&Action=U&FOCUS=Applicant&SiteId=19&JobOpeningId=14958&PostingSeq=1

title: Backend Engineer_new
summary: Backend—Haskell, Yesod, Persistent: Integrating with banking services and third party APIs to accurately track financial data and make payments.
description:
Backend Engineer
San Francisco
Remote (US/Canada)
Full-time
Haskell, TypeScript, Nix, Swift
Mercury is building a bank for startups. We launched about a year ago with the basic functionality of a bank, and now we’re refining our product and building out new features. Thankfully, our customers seem to like what we’ve built so far:
Technically, we’re working on these challenges:
Frontend—React, Typescript, Redux: Creating a beautiful user interface. We iterate on designs and don’t compromise until we have a great product.
Backend—Haskell, Yesod, Persistent: Integrating with banking services and third party APIs to accurately track financial data and make payments.
Operations—Nix, Postgres, AWS: Maintaining a stable, secure fleet of servers.
Mobile—Swift, Kotlin: We released a native iOS App in May, and we plan to develop an Android app as well.
As a backend engineer, you’ll do things like:
Provide a backend to our iOS and web frontends, to do things like search transactions or send wire transfers
Integrate with third party APIs, to do things like send checks or validate SWIFT codes
Build admin tools, to do things like identify fraudulent customers or help manage accounts
While you would primarily work with Haskell, you’d preferably learn enough React and TypeScript to construct simple admin pages. The ideal candidate has done full-stack or backend engineering before, and is familiar with or wants to learn about Haskell.
Challenge.
We’re shaking up one of the least innovative, most powerful industries around, eliminating pain points faced by every startup, and filling a crucial missing piece in the tech ecosystem.
Building a bank from the ground up is a big project; the product is complex and cannot break, there are stringent regulations, and we’ll have to outcompete some of the largest, most entrenched corporations in the world. But overcoming these challenges means we’ll have built something that lasts.
Impact.
Working on a lean, self-motivated team means autonomy, broad experience across projects, and seeing your contributions directly shape the product and impact users.
Working on a greenfield project means you’ll have to make foundational decisions; starting from scratch requires more thought than adding to existing infrastructure, and your architectural choices will serve as the bedrock of future development.
Quality.
Building things correctly is fundamental to being a bank. There’s no room for sloppy code or technical debt, which means doing things like using static typing and immutability, designing database schemas with checks and foreign key constraints, and carefully reviewing teammates’ code.
One of the core complaints about banking is usability, so we try to think hard about how to build features that users love; see our blog post on our date picker for an example. Our goal is to be proud of what we’ve crafted.
Perks
Health/Dental/Vision
401(K) matching
Unlimited vacation policy (with mandatory minimum)
12-weeks parental leave
Commuter benefits
Wellness benefits
Paid lunch
Stocked kitchen
With a great blender
And a panini maker
Custom equipment setup
Book budget
Record budget
Wirecutter-recommended surge protectors
Office with edgy black wooden floors
Personalized callsign
(Subjectively) cool t-shirts and jackets
Dogs/cats very welcome
Free tea
Culture at Mercury
   Be super helpful
Go above and beyond to solve problems. Exercise empathy. Deliver magic to customers and coworkers.
   Think actively
Question processes. Give thoughtful responses to questions you’re asked. Figure out the best way to do something instead of going by how it’s always been done.
   Appreciate quality
Take pride in crafting a product that will last. Avoid cutting corners. Work with the best equipment and software. Invest in great things that make your life better.
   Act with humility
Treat everyone with respect. Leave egos at the door.
   Maximize efficiency
Minimize unnecessary meetings and management. Work together with others to get the job finished.
   Focus on product
Ask yourself how the product can be better today than it was yesterday.

Providing a backend to our iOS and web frontends, to do things like search transactions or send wire transfers .'}]

description:
Opower Product Manager | Utility Data Integration Platform-210007DR

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications

At Oracle Utilities, we know that by engaging utility customers about their energy use, we can help them save energy and improve their relationship with their utility. We are passionate about helping utilities and their customers move toward a clean energy future.
Our client databases contain the world’s largest collection of energy usage data and utility customer data. From this tremendous data asset, we are able to develop the insights that make our customer engagement products relevant, help us measure the results of our programs, and give our clients insights about their customers that they can use in other channels and products.
To help make the above possible, our key strength as Oracle Utilities lies in leading with a quick and easy client data integration and onboarding journey. We’re looking to hire a PM who can propel that story forward to address needs in the evolving utility landscape. Our product managers are also product owners and you'll have end-to-end ownership of your product space, and be responsible for strategy, execution, and go-to-market.
Responsibilities
Own the UGBU’s Utility Data Integration Platform vision and roadmap with clearly defined milestones and success metrics
Work closely with internal and external systems integration teams to understand their needs to inform roadmap
Work closely with sales, marketing, and account teams to understand client/buyer needs to inform
Identify new initiatives and develop product plans that clearly articulate options with a business case for investment
Demonstrate outstanding product design and technical decisions in driving execution of the product roadmap with the engineering team
Deeply learn about and understand the platform technologies used at Opower
Review design documents and architecture, and participate in general technical discussions
Actively manage projects cross-functionally to ensure successful outcomes.
 About You
Fantastic analytical skills; ability to solve problems quickly, establish frameworks, think on your feet and generalize solutions
Excellent oral and written communication skills, tailored for a wide variety of audiences
Degree in Computer Science or other technical degree
2+ years of experience in a software product management role
Experience leading a team through various cycles of product planning and implementation.
Experience with Agile and developing SaaS products desired
Familiarity with Data integration tools and/or Data platform technologies is desired

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Work as part of a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.

As a member of the product development division, you will define product specifications and or strategy. Gather and analyze information to define product specifications and review design specifications. Communicate product strategy and functionality. Initiate and foster relationships with other groups. Review product documentation and collateral. Ensure successful product releases based on corporate priorities.

Duties and tasks are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.

Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Compensation & Rewards Partner - M&A
summary: Ensure flawless data integrity and inform colleagues within Employee Success and in the business on the importance and downstream impacts of key data elements.
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Employee Success Group
Job Details
Compensation & Rewards Partner
We’re looking for a Compensation & Rewards Partner to join our team as we scale to support rapid business growth via acquisition. Our ideal candidate will have experience with compensation, a passion for data, analytics, and tools but most of all a solution-oriented mindset. The ideal candidate wants to understand how all of the puzzle pieces fit together to solve for scale and a world class acquired employee experience.


Your Impact:
Rewards Integration
Drive the mapping and leveling process for a small deal or for a given function or functions within a larger deal as a component of the integration of acquired employees; taking full ownership of the work stream and progress for the group(s) for which you are responsible
Support the due diligence process as needed with extreme sensitivity to the confidential nature of the work
Facilitate meetings between business leaders, Employee Success and other stakeholders on mapping and leveling to ensure alignment with compensation philosophy and values
Ensure flawless data integrity and inform colleagues within Employee Success and in the business on the importance and downstream impacts of key data elements
Influence Rewards-related decisions, balancing cost, operational and administrative efficiency and employee experience
Responsible for creating, reviewing and updating content related to Rewards (looping in additional contributors as needed) for Employee Information Sessions; delivering the content as needed
Look for opportunities to leverage technology to minimize data issues and manual work that cannot scale
Proactively identify and raise awareness about concerns or risks and participate in resolving them
Act as a subject matter expert on our Rewards programs and practices and represent the team with groups internal to Salesforce including Employee Success, Corporate Development, Finance and in the business
Deal-related Program / Project Management
Act as the point of contact for all things Rewards (Compensation, Benefits, Immigration & Mobility) on a given deal, looping in the appropriate resource(s) as needed and following up on any action items
Train Total Rewards team members as needed on tools (OrgVue, Pre-Boarding app, Google sheets modeling) and processes for M&A transactions, providing context and guidance as needed
Partner with team members to ensure Rewards workstreams are in alignment with overall integration goals and timelines, keeping ES M&A, Finance and other stakeholders informed throughout
Create and maintain reports and dashboards on Rewards work streams
Special Projects
Participate in projects to help advance the M&A practice within Global Rewards including documentation, enablement and acquired employee/leader initiatives
Put innovation at the forefront of everything we do; continuously looking for process improvements, thinking outside the box
Use business savvy and proactive thinking to ensure we’re always one step ahead of what is coming next
Participate in Total Rewards special projects as needed with enthusiasm and desire for professional development

Required Skills/Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum of 7 years of work experience in Compensation, M&A or a related HR field
Advanced skills in MS Excel and Google Suite with additional experience with Salesforce a plus
Comfortable with various HR technologies including Workday and any other database management systems but also comfortable with learning new systems
An aptitude for math/finance and analytical mindset with ability to use data to tell a story
Outstanding communication (written and verbal), organizational, problem solving skills
Flawless eye for detail
Comfortable working in an environment where operating “in the gray area” is the norm
Ability to multi-task and prioritize while managing tight deadlines
Perform well under pressure, work independently and as a part of a team in a fast paced environment
Self-motivated and able to take a request and run with it under minimal direction and supervision
Flexible and able to quickly change course when the needs of the business and our team shift direction or accelerate delivery
Comfortable handling highly confidential employee data on a regular basis
Preferred Skills/Experience:
Good business acumen and awareness of business trends in Compensation and/or HR Technology
Systems and technical aptitude
High tech industry experience preferred
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

title: Client Service Associate
summary:
As necessary, utilize custodial websites, CRM client database and APX portfolio management system.
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals;…
description:
Description
At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.

Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day
First Republic Private Wealth Management is comprised of investment management, brokerage, trust, financial planning and insurance professionals. We offer customized wealth management solutions for our clients from a wide array of services including comprehensive investment management, financial planning, estate planning, trust services, endowment management and more. Our goal is to understand our clients' unique needs and support them throughout a lifetime of financial goals.

Responsibilities
Common goals, uncommon potential
As a Client Service Associate, ideal candidates will act as a liaison between the Wealth Managers, the clients, and Private Wealth Management middle office and operations teams. This position requires strong relationship management skills, acute attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and a client centric mindset to provide outstanding service to both internal and external clients. As a member of a multi-person team, the ability to work well within the team and communicate openly is of particular value.

What you'll do as a Client Service Associate:
Provide sales and service support (i.e., create, review and distribute various client reports and presentations or assist with client events); may be for current clients or prospects.Research and respond to client inquiries and/or problems of high net worth clients, including account change requests; escalate issues as appropriate.Assist with phone calls to prospects and clients, schedule all client-related appointments, coordinate client mailings/invitations to company events.Provide general administrative support such as managing logistics and refreshments for meetings, answering incoming telephone calls, managing incoming emails/faxes, filing, submitting business expense requests, schedule appointments and distributing mail.Place equity, mutual fundand fixed income trades for brokerage clients, process money market movements or account maintenance at custodian and in CRM system. As necessary, utilize custodial websites, CRM client database and APX portfolio management system. Produce reports upon request.Create and maintain client files in CRM and other systems or hard-copies (then pass on to the Operations team).Assist with the completion and transmission of transaction documents including: preparing transaction documents, reviewing completed/signed transaction documents to ensure compliance and accuracy, establishing and maintaining file folders, maintaining document copies, processing investment/bank transactions, and communicating with operations/billing/internal departments/First Republic Securities Company and other custodians with regard to transaction processing follow-upClient interaction: act as conduit between client and PWM operations, create business plans geared toward client growth, build relationships with clients, initiate daily contact with clients and make frequent office visits, introduce technology and services to client as appropriate, cross sell PWM's products, services and/or technology, monitor client investing and understand their rationale or intentions/goals.Perform duties and responsibilities specific to department functions/activities or as assigned by the supervisor.Participate in the development of department policies and/or procedures and assist with client specific projects as assigned.Responsibilities include the following: 1) adheringto and complying with the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, includingthose related to Anti-money laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US PATRIOT Act, etc.) 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completingrequired training, 4) identifying and reporting suspicious activity to the AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank.

Qualifications
You could be a great fit if you have:
BS/BA degree in Business, Finance or related field, or equivalent experienceSeries 7 and 66 Licenses, or ability to obtain within 6 months if trading is required for the positionStrong analytical skills with the ability to synthesize informationStrong presentation skills; comfortable speaking in front of clients and potential clientsProven self-starter attitude with the ability to think and work autonomouslyEffective prioritization capabilitiesTeam player mindset; willing to help and learn from othersExcellent written and verbal skills with careful attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft office applications with an intermediate to expert skill level in Excel and PPT
Job Demands:

Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.
Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship.

First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

Lay the groundwork for a dynamic future with an industry leader. At Kaiser Permanente, you'll forge lasting relationships with colleagues across the organization while enjoying the opportunity to grow your experience and hone your expertise on assignments that have real impact. Our interns have worked on everything from analyzing financial software and developing new marketing strategies, to designing mobile apps and helping clinicians improve care delivery. We want you to get the most out of your time here and will give you projects that challenge you to think freely, question thoroughly, and explore deeply.

Total Compensation department is part of Total Rewards, provides compensation support to Northern California, assisting with salary and bonus related issues. Determining wages, analyzing the market, writing job descriptions, etc.
Internship Project Description:

Our intern will work on analyzing data, developing and running reports, summarizing findings, coordinating employee mapping and review processes. Literary / internet searches on compensation practices, summarizing and presenting results.

Advanced excel (pivot tables, lookups, create formulas, etc.) and powerpoint skills. Prefer database experience as well, understanding how to run a query, etc. Experience analyzing and summarizing findings.

title: Associate Director, Commercial Data Science & AI
summary: Responsible for advanced data science expertise to multiple cross-functional projects and drive delivery of complex data science solutions that drive value to…
description:
At AstraZeneca, we’re not afraid to do things differently. We’re resetting expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, groundbreaking and ground-breaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together.
The Oncology therapy area at AstraZeneca is unparalleled. We have built and strategically acquired one of the most promising Oncology pipelines in the industry. You will be among inspiring oncology industry leaders who will keep you engaged and empower you to be the best. We seek out opportunities to do dynamic and significant work which means we won't just follow the same course of action time and again if we can see potential in a different way of building life changing medicines.
Associate Director, Commercial Data Sciences & AI is a key member of the OBU Data Sciences team supporting the delivery of data science capability ad solutions across the OBU commercial business. This responsibility includes working closely with cross functional business leaders to help match the potential of effective data science applications to the most urgent business questions and needs.
This role will build delivery the data science expertise to deliver business solutions which offer innovative and effective approaches based on rich data science experience to enhance commercial execution globally. The role will sit in the Commercial Operations Team and is expected to make a strong contribution to the commercial business at Global and Priority market levels.
Typical Accountabilities
Delivery of novel modelling solutions designed to drive the interrogation of datasets for insights in scientific and business application areas. These solutions include the application of specialized approaches in classification, regression, clustering, NLP, image analysis, graph theory and/or other techniques.
Using domain-specific understanding, translates unstructured, complex business problems into the appropriate data problem, model and analytical solutions across multiple projects
Oversee the researching and developing of predictive models and computational methods to guide and influence decision-making outcomes
Develop effective relationships with commercial and medical leaders to ensure utilization and value of information resources and services in multiple projects.
Responsible for advanced data science expertise to multiple cross-functional projects and drive delivery of complex data science solutions that drive value to AstraZeneca
Lead and apply ongoing knowledge and awareness in trends, standard methodology and new developments in analytics and data science to influence functional practices.
Collaborates across the AstraZeneca Data and AI community to develop best practices and cross functional opportunities that drive value
Oversight of partnerships with multiple third parties, academic or outsourced partners to shape and drive project outcomes and knowledge building
Essential
Bachelors Degree (or equivalent numbers of years of experience) in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, computational sciences or a related quantitative discipline.
In-depth experience with modern data science approaches, including unsupervised and supervised classification and regression algorithms such as k-means clustering, support vector machines, random forests, neural networks and deep learning. May also have expertise in advanced statistical modelling, or broader aspects of applied mathematics such as dynamical systems or optimization.
Significant experience in the modelling of complex datasets in applied business and/or scientific application domains
Advanced software development skills in at least two of the standard data science languages (such as R, Julia or Python) and familiarity with database systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, graph)
In-depth experience of manipulating and analyzing large high dimensionality unstructured datasets, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders
Understanding of algorithm design, development, optimization, scaling and applications
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills
Desirable
Master or PhD degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, or a related quantitative discipline.
Comfortable working in high performance computing or cloud environment
Proven track record of publishing relevant predictive modelling results and tools in peer-reviewed journals, conferences, and other scientific proceedings.
Experience in life sciences and healthcare
Experience in novel methods development and application
Experience in a complex global organization
Experience in leading and managing junior colleagues
Experience in influencing and controlling budgets
Why AstraZeneca?
At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey.
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

Description
Hospice East Bay provides compassionate end-of-life services to terminally ill patients in our community, while offering emotional, spiritual, logistical and bereavement support for their families and caregivers. Our vision is to build a diverse workplace that is both professionally stimulating and personally satisfying—an environment of collaboration, celebration, opportunity and growth.

HEB is looking for a Team Assistant that is passionate about our patients, their families, and the community we serve. Come grow with us!

Our Employee Benefits

Hospice East Bay is committed to providing a comprehensive benefits and compensation package for our employees. Our health benefits include 100% employer-paid premiums for our high deductible medical plan offered with a Health Savings Plan partially employer funded for eligible employees. Employer paid dental and vision premiums, Additional benefits include generous paid time off program, educational assistance, and employer-matched contributions to our retirement plan (up to $2,000 annually), Life/AD&D coverage, a comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, and convenient discounts on many services, including gym memberships, dry cleaning, produce delivery, mobile phone service, and automotive care.


Position Summary

This position reports to the Clinical Team Manager and is responsible for providing administrative support for the Clinical staff. The incumbent receives functional and professional guidance from clinical management.

Essential Functions

Train/ educate other Team Secretaries on new or revised processes
Review/ audit patient medical records in All Docs
Enter/ update/ quality review of patient data on network including all status changes, demographics, etc.
Email/ update medication lists for MD or NP daily
Communicate with Admissions Team regarding follow up on outstanding items for new patient admissions
Maintains monthly re-cert calendar and keep Nurses/ MD notified on a regular basis of outstanding items
Prepare/ set up/ attend & take minutes for weekly IDT meetings
Prep weekly for IDT meetings including printing/ distributing agendas, reports, med lists, and patient schedules for RCFE, SNF, ALF patients
Review that all IDT notes have been entered after weekly IDT meetings
Answer overflow of telephone calls when Triage, Case Manager, and Team Manager are not available
Create/ review/ print/ fax/ track/ and approve all orders, certifications, recertification’s, and CTI’s
Facilitate communication with facilities, providers, patients and families
Perform additional duties as required by Team Managers to support smooth operations of department and agency
Fax orders and other necessary paperwork to SNF, BC and ALF patients
Educate RN’s and other Team Members of Netsmart and paperwork flow/ functions if needed
Cover other Team Secretaries for absences, vacations, etc.
Distribute faxes from clinical and copy room fax machines
Print/ email emergency evacuation list daily
Enter notice of elections (NOE) into Netsmart daily for billing department
Order/ arrange/ track/ enter all DME orders into online DME ordering system and Netsmart
Arrange switch out of equipment with outside DME agencies
Review/ distribute death/ discharge and patient admission report daily
Review/ update weekly Kaiser Divert list
Update/ distribute SNF visit log regularly to MD’s
Prepare/ distribute patient information to SNF, B&C, ALF, Bruns , other Hospices for transferring or traveling patients
Order/ copy/ stock all forms used in the Clinical Area
Pull/ review/ follow up on weekly reports such as Open Orders/ Unverfied Services and report back to Team Manager
Prepare/ email LVN visit check report to all RNCM’s weekly
Attend meetings/ sit on committees as needed (i.e. Safety, QAPI, Staff, IDT)
Using Enclara website print & distribute CII prescriptions for MD signature then fax back to Enclara daily

Position Requirements

Demonstrate excellent communication and customer service skills.
Ability to recognize, anticipate and coordinate the maintenance requirements of an In-Patient facility.
Excellent attention to detail.
Ability to work in busy environment, handle multiple priorities and frequent changes in daily assignments.
Ability to work independently and follow through with tasks.
Knowledge of medical terminology.
Ability to represent the agency to the public with a professional image.
Perform as a team player working cohesively with other team members and agency staff.

Experience and Education

High school diploma or equivalent; college degree preferred.
Computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Experience with data input in a clinical system database preferred.
Previous experience working in a health care/hospice or non-profit setting.
Additional Information
FTE:
.0
Schedule:
Variable shift

description:
Company Description

Bold. Results. Rauxa is the full-service agency that is rooted in data, enabled by technology, inspired to create and orchestrated to perform for Verizon, Alaska Airlines, Chase, TGI Fridays, and more than 20 other leading brands. Founded in 1999 and with a uniquely independent spirit, Rauxa is powered by a team of over 300 creators, technologists, scientists and practitioners with locations in New York, Seattle, San Francisco, Santa Monica, and Orange County. Rauxa is part of Publicis Media, one of four solution hubs within Publicis Groupe.

Job Description

Rauxa is seeking a Business Analyst or Sr. Business Analyst to help define project scope and business requirements, develop technical specifications, and provide a channel between technical and creative teams in the web design and development process.
This is a temporary/freelance position to start immediately.
Overview:
The Business Analyst or Sr. Business Analyst will also collaborate with teams to define, build, and rollout innovative technology and business process solutions to increase efficiencies, improve customer satisfaction, and drive revenue. The ideal candidate has experience working on web development, CMS, and content projects in a digital or advertising agency.
What You’ll Do:
You will develop design and functional specifications
You will produce deliverables for web projects
You will gather requirements
You will assist in post-implementation support and system enhancements
You will oversee the development, implementation, and maintenance of web sites and other web-based applications designed to meet business goals
You will oversee complex system projects that support business-to-customer web sites
You will work with teams of internal and external web designers, developers, project managers, and content specialists to define, design, monitor, and improve web applications
You will apply functional knowledge to the design and configuration of systems
You will maintain strong relationships with web associates, database administrators, system administrators, the marketing team, application developers, and IT to meet objectives

Qualifications

Who You Are:
You have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferred
You have 3-5 years of experience as Business Analyst (PM skills a plus) ideally in a CMS (Content Management) environment and with client facing experience
You have agile methodology experience and a strong perspective on how to bring a project to life
You have a deep understanding of the components and considerations required when building corporate systems (i.e. key architecture components, security, scalability etc.)
You have proven experience in specifying and implementing enterprise content management systems
You have demonstrated track record identifying and documenting business requirements, process flows, use cases and test cases for sales portals or content management systems
You have experience working with user-experience professionals in the development of interaction design deliverables (i.e. wireframes, prototyping, visual design)
You have experience with developing, deploying, and maintaining websites and other web-based applications
You have experience with Web and IT environments, including implementation and support of resource planning, support, training, and documentation
You have experience with Web servers and system administration
You are knowledgeable of website technology: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Plus)
You have the ability to work Pacific Coast Time hours.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:
Position Description:

The UC Research Initiatives Program Officer position reports to the Director, UC Research Initiatives (UCRI). UCRI aims to enhance the UC research enterprise systemwide by fostering innovative research and collaboration across the UC campuses, medical centers and UC-managed national labs. This position has primary responsibility for program development and planning, peer reviewer and applicant relations, grant application and award management, program evaluation and analysis, and representing the program and disseminating research findings to a broad range of stakeholders concerned with UC research across the system. The ideal candidate has an advanced degree with specialization in either physical or computational sciences, atmospheric sciences, or engineering with broad research exposure, and research program administration and/or grants management experience in an academic setting. Enthusiasm for enhancing the UC research enterprise and advancing the University's research mission, and a commitment to diversifying the research workforce at all levels, are key components of this position. In addition to primary responsibilities within UCRI grant-making programs, the incumbent will participate in RGPO-wide special projects and provide cross-functional expertise to other RGPO grant-making programs as needed.

Qualifications:
Required Qualifications
Experience and leadership ability in research program planning, academic program review, research program oversight, or peer review in a content area relevant to the UCRI Portfolio.
Demonstrated experience in research management, including knowledge of research grants administration and policy. Experience with research proposal preparation and with evaluating research reports and budgets to assess compliance and modification requests.
Proven project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects with a proactive, results-oriented approach. Strong organizational and planning skills. Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines with initiative, and successfully lead complex projects with minimum supervision.
Excellent problem-solving skills and judgment. Advanced skills in analyzing information, identifying solutions, evaluating their implications, and formulating alternatives, particularly in relation to research management.
Outstanding collaboration and demonstrated teamwork ability.
Excellent client relations skills. Ability to establish and maintain cooperative and mutually supportive working relationships with a range of internal and external colleagues and stakeholders.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills to both establish trust, and to translate complex scientific concepts into everyday prose.
Facility with all commonly-used office software (eg: Outlook, WORD, Excel, Visio, Box) required.
Preferred Qualifications
PhD or equivalent experience in the physical or computational sciences, atmospheric sciences, or engineering, to complement team expertise. Broad exposure to research related to key disciplines in the UCRI portfolio strongly preferred.
Ability to assess research outcomes in fields outside that of disciplinary expertise or field of the earned doctorate. Ability to contribute to program planning and grants oversight in a wide-range of disciplines beyond own disciplinary expertise.
Direct experience facilitating the smooth conduct of collaborative or multi-location research projects strongly preferred. Enthusiasm for supporting a range of research endeavors that advance the UC research enterprise strongly preferred.
Demonstrated interest in and commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in research training, research grantmaking, the conduct of research and in supporting the public benefit of research.
Knowledge of UC policies and procedures and research-related experience at UC or at one of the UC-managed national laboratories a plus.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a high volume, fast-paced work environment.
Facility with web-based database and content management systems desirable. Familiarity with evaluation tools like SciVal, and programming languages (eg python, R, or other coding) to facilitate portfolio-wide data analysis for UCRI and RGPO.
Education
Advanced degree in relevant academic discipline area and/or equivalent experience/training.
To Apply:

Please visit this website for more information on the position and to submit an application.


The University of California, Office of the President, is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. EEO/AA Employer UC Nondiscrimination Policy

The University of California, Office of the President, strives to make this job board accessible to any and all users. If you have comments regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at: Accessibility or email the Human Resource Department at: epost@ucop.edu.

description:
Company Description
The Twitter Service organization creates meaningful connections with our customers that promote healthy exchange in the public conversation. We do this by developing and operating customer support solutions at scale in a rapidly changing global environment. The Launch team manages key initiatives for the Twitter Service organization, designed to implement world class customer support and operations for Twitter’s products, applications, and platform. We create clarity and focus for the organization to ensure we are meeting our collective, customer focused goals.

Job Description
The Human Computation team’s mission is to streamline production of high-quality labeled data and context-based insights & measurement, in support of Machine Learning, offline metrics, and ALL other human-in-the-loop initiatives across Twitter. Our work directly impacts the quality and consumption of our most popular products, helping to prevent the abuse and misuse of Twitter, and delighting our ever expanding global user base.
We’re looking for a dynamic Technical Program Manager who has a consistent track record of designing and driving high-impact high-visibility Engineering and Engineering support programs. The right person would have experience driving projects/initiatives for Human Computation/ Data Annotation and working cross-functionally (across Engineering, Product, Research, Legal, Operations) in support of large company objectives. They would also have experience working with multiple global staffing vendors, running scaled contingent business resources, and effectively navigating a fast-paced, and dynamic daily working environment.
Responsibilities:
Independently drive goals, roadmap, priorities, and initiatives in their own product area, to ensure support for Machine Learning projects and accurate qualitative measurements.
Drive the development of various technical solutions that are critical to running Human Computation effectively and efficiently, at scale. Manage internal and external tooling backlogs.
Find opportunities, define, scope, and get agreement across cross-functional partners for projects that can leverage human evaluations to improve existing Machine Learning models and research in support of opportunity sizing new features/understanding usage behavior of new launches.
Work directly with Engineers, Product Managers, Researchers, and Data Scientists to define, scope, build, and execute human evaluations in support of different areas of the product.
Work with cross-functional partners across Operations, Policy, Legal, Procurement, and external vendors to produce quarterly roadmaps in support of top-level company goals.
Write clear and concise technical documentation and obtain agreement from leadership across a wide variety of stakeholder teams.
Review and provide feedback on technical design documents, with respect to Human Computation’s scope.
Train, oversee, and own accountability for an international and designated contingent team, large-scale and multilingual liquid workforce, and a crowdsourced workforce.
Effectively determine contingent staffing needs; implement effective roles, responsibilities, and distributed team structure.
Review and/or process critical and potentially disturbing content including but not limited to pornographic images, child pornography, vulgar language, hate speech, violent threats, and other graphic images.

Qualifications
Over 2 years of experience driving large scale Engineering & Engineering-support programs.
Over 2 year direct experience with Human Computation, crowdsourcing, or experimental design.
Over 1 year experience with HTML, XML, CSS, JavaScript, and SQL or specialized database query languages.
Proven ability to identify and resolve systemic issues in both software and people systems.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, organizational skills, and highly developed interpersonal skills.
Active, passionate Twitter user with a strong interest in social media. Passionate interest in Twitter’s products and mission, and about the role machine learning could play towards advancing them.
Additional Information
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer
summary: DevOps here at Conviva is 30% Development and 70% Operations, focused on backend software engineering, data processing, application architecture, APIs, and…
description:
Have you streamed a program on Disney+, caught the latest binge-worthy series on Hulu, or tuned in for NFL highlights on social media? If the answer is yes, you have already benefitted from Conviva's technology.

At Conviva, we create the technologies and standards driving industry transformation and streaming media growth worldwide. It's not about the data, it's about what you do with it. As the leader in global streaming media intelligence, Conviva measures in excess of 500 million unique viewers watching 150 billion streams per year with 1.5 trillion real-time transactions per day across more than 180 countries. Our platform and products are designed to deliver the real-time, cross-screen, integrated insights our customers need to understand their business and focus on what matters. Join us as we make streaming better.

DevOps here at Conviva is 30% Development and 70% Operations, focused on backend software engineering, data processing, application architecture, APIs, and internal tools. On the Ops side, we focus on Linux configuration management, cloud automation, infrastructure as code, virtualization and containers, network engineering, security, database architecture, continuous integration, network filesystems, and web scale production infrastructure. We use agile sprint models to support several development teams that build web services and front-end components. We actively iterate our processes with input from the team. We also run our own projects related to infrastructure, automation, monitoring, continuous integration and internal tools. Our job is to increase development velocity and ensure stable and secure production systems.

What you get to do

Work with development teams to build and maintain cloud environments to specifications developed closely with multiple teams
Support (and automate) the deployment of applications into those environments
Design new environments and architectures
Automate everything. Build proactive monitoring and alerting tools. Provide standards, documentation, and coaching to developers. Participate in on-call rotations.

What you bring to the role

5+ years of experience in DevOps including automated system configuration, application deployment, and infrastructure-as-code
Advanced Linux system administration abilities
Real-world experience managing large-scale AWS environments. Multi-account management a plus.
Experience with managing production environments on AWS or another cloud PaaS
Solid hands on skills with a majority of the following technologies: Kubernetes, Rancher, Apache, Hadoop, Docker, EC2/ECS, S3, CloudFront, ECS, NFS, AWS SDKs & CLI Tools, Ruby, Python, Bash, Git, DNS, SSL, MySQL, Nagios, Prometheus, InfluxDB/Grafana, Puppet, Ansible
Experience working as a developer on front-end or back-end projects is a big plus

Conviva is the leader in streaming media intelligence, powered by its real-time platform. More than 250 industry leaders and brands – including CBS, CCTV, Cirque Du Soleil, DAZN, Disney+, HBO, Hulu, Sky, Sling TV, TED, Univision, and WarnerMedia – rely on Conviva to maximize their consumer engagement, deliver the quality experiences viewers expect and drive revenue growth. With a global footprint of more than 500 million unique viewers watching 150 billion streams per year across 3 billion applications streaming on devices, Conviva offers streaming providers unmatched scale for continuous video measurement, intelligence and benchmarking across every stream, every screen, every second. Conviva is privately held and headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with offices around the world. For more information, please visit us at www.conviva.com.

 As part of our Data & AI group, you will lead technology innovation for our clients through robust delivery of world-class solutions. You will build better software better! Come grow your career in Technology at Accenture!

on new assignments with guidance.

title: HEALTH & WELFARE BENEFITS CONSULTANT
company: University of California Office of the President
summary:
Respond to information requests for employee health and welfare data, from internal UC or external parties.
O Windows and the Microsoft Office suite including…
description:
Location: Oakland
Job ID: 15173

Job Posting


For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP


UC OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT

At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.

The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, five medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

Systemwide Benefits Programs & Strategy manages and creates health benefits strategy and programs that enhance the well-being of our employees and their families.

POSITION SUMMARY

This position provides high-level vendor management and operational support to the health and welfare benefits programs for UC faculty, staff, retirees and their dependents. The position is responsible for technical leadership, analytical support, and problem solving associated with assigned vendors. Using skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of medical and non-medical benefits industry practices and related policies and procedures, the position ensures vendor provision of contracted services. Incumbent is the recognized expert in administering the organization's benefits programs including plan design, operational procedures, policies, enrollment and other processes. Provides analytical support for legal and contract compliance issues, and conducts operational performance improvement projects. Problems addressed are of a diverse scope where management of issues or data requires in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. The position requires collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues and business partners in a complex organizational structure. The incumbent has strong self-initiative and is able to prioritize and complete multiple projects on tight timeframes. Assists in identifying departmental goals and objectives and strives to achieve them. Cultivates and maintains productive professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders to assigned plans.


Responsibilities

30%

Monitor and analyze vendor service level metrics and performance guarantees impacting operational and contract performance, and recommend changes as appropriate. Manage activities to ensure new programs and plan changes are correctly implemented by vendors. Identify areas for improvement when issues or concerns arise and develop procedures to mitigate gaps. Discuss directly with vendor account teams to resolve operational issues and establish operational changes to resolve problems. Operational issues generally involve problems without precedent impacting the operation of the assigned vendor's plan on a systemwide basis. Coordinate activities with vendors to develop and deliver administrative manuals and training to location benefits offices to ensure consistent benefits delivery. Review and direct implementation of plan communications to members. Conduct on-site visits to monitor compliance and operational efficiency. Review contracts with vendors for compliance and adherence to applicable laws, rules, regulations, guidelines and policies, in partnership with Office of General Counsel, Health & Welfare Policy and other departments. Ensure contract development includes review of potential risk and consequences of policies and legislation. Collaborate with colleagues to ensure UC policy and regulatory requirements are met. Respond to information requests for employee health and welfare data, from internal UC or external parties. Assist Senior Director and Managers in development of materials for senior leadership, including reports, presentations and speaking points on policies, plan design and administration, industry trends and technical information.


25%

Interpret and administer plan administration documents for assigned vendors, including contracts, summary plan descriptions, operational manuals, University regulations, etc. Provide written clarification of policies and procedures, often dealing with unique issues/problems without precedent and/or structure. Responsible for monitoring carrier/administrator performance to ensure delivery of efficient and effective service and compliance with contract terms and conditions. Collaborate with assigned vendors and other units within Human Resources, UC Office of the President, and at the Locations to provide the appropriate levels of service and ensure contract fulfillment. May participate in projects to develop University systems which help ensure compliance with contract and policy provisions (payroll, demographic data, services and communications). Ensure accurate payment of vendor fees and premiums to ensure proper management of financial resources; may involve review and approval of payments/adjustments to vendors.


25%

Lead operational implementation of new vendors and program changes. Strive to achieve consistency, where appropriate, between vendors' contracts. Ensure proper day-to-day maintenance of vendor contracts. Provide input on operational topics during bids and annual contract renewal process to minimize operational risk and ensure more effective vendor services, including: analyzing vendor responses, identifying issues impacting the administration of the Plan or requiring resolution on a systemwide basis, and recommending changes to policy or procedures that result in operational improvements to existing processes. During program development and throughout renewal process, partner with colleagues to ensure seamless integration of financial goals and benefit structure with plan administration and operations. In coordination with colleagues, provide input to define, design and implement new and continuing vendor management requirements. Provide input on service level performance results and penalties during contract renewal process.


20%

Analyze and trend vendor performance against participant satisfaction surveys. Provide technical leadership to UC stakeholders of vendor services (benefits offices, HCFs, etc.) Research, analyze, and recommend responses to the most difficult participant issues and inquiries escalated from campus benefits managers, directly from employees, or sent to UCOP management.


Required Qualifications

3 years experience working with the implementation and administration of health and welfare benefits programs with a focus on operational oversight and problem resolution is required; 5 years is preferred.
Ability to: Guide and negotiate complex issues through a hierarchical, bureaucratic organization to achieve resolution. o Use original thinking and independent judgment to develop solutions reflecting the legal, policy, and operational needs of the organization. o Present complex benefit design and finance related information in a clear and concise manner, both in writing and verbally. Ability to present information effectively to small or large groups, internal or external to the organization. o Correlate project tasks to program objectives and departmental goals o Work independently, following through on assignments with minimal supervision and balancing multiple projects simultaneously with demanding timeframes. o Organize, coordinate and complete projects effectively and within deadlines, while upholding a penchant for detail and a commitment to accuracy. o Lead cross-disciplinary teams and facilitate consensus-based teamwork for productive outcomes. Promote the exchange of information among project team members and support staff, and convey appropriate information to project executive sponsors. o Establish and maintain trust, confidence, and effective working relationships with colleagues and individuals of diverse occupational and social backgrounds. o Apply political acumen to intricate situations occurring in a complex organizational structure.
Knowledge of: Principles and procedures of fully-insured and self-insured/self-funded large group benefit plan administration. o Current literature, trends, and developments in the field of benefit program administration. o Principles and practices required to develop, implement, and evaluate health and welfare benefit programs o Legal regulations applicable to employee benefit programs. o University policies, procedures, practices, objectives and structure applicable to employee benefit programs. o Windows and the Microsoft Office suite including word-processing, spreadsheet applications, project management and database programs.
Demonstrated skill in: Principles and processes of project management. o Written and verbal communication. o Analyzing and synthesizing information and developing sound and relevant recommendations. o Determining root cause of problems and recommending creative, resourceful solutions that address concerns of stakeholders and take into consideration the often-conflicting needs of diverse constituents. o Customer service, with the ability to anticipate and develop solutions to client concerns, while being flexible and willing to adapt based on client feedback.

Education

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Operations Management, Business or a related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

SALARY AND BENEFITS

Salary: The recommended hiring range is $84,000 to $98,900. Commensurate with experience.

Benefits: For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit: Benefits of Belonging

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

HOW TO APPLY

Please be prepared to attach a cover letter and resume with your application.

APPLICATION REVIEW DATE

The first review date for this job is February 26, 2021. The position will be open until filled.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Background Check Process: Successful completion of a background check is required for this critical position. Background check process at UCOP

Smoke Free Work Environment: The University of California, Office of the President, is smoke & tobacco-free as of January 1, 2014. UC Smoke & Tobacco Free Policy

EEO STATEMENT

The University of California, Office of the President, is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. EEO/AA Employer UC Nondiscrimination Policy

The University of California, Office of the President, strives to make this job board accessible to any and all users. If you have comments regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at: Accessibility or email the Human Resource Department at: epost@ucop.edu.
