title: Full Stack Engineer - CO
location: San Francisco, CA 94103 (South of Market area)
summary:
Experience with distributed storage (e.g. Cassandra) and relational database (e.g. MySQL) systems.
To build and match customers with the best care channels …
description:
Product teams at Uber create the vision for the future of urban mobility: deeply understanding our customers to solve their transportation needs with innovative technology. Data underpins our products, enabling intelligent decision making and improved user experiences. Leveraging the latest ML, Big Data, data visualization, and NLP technologies, the Product Platform team works at the intersection of engineering and data science to enhance our services and deliver actionable insights.
About the Role
As a Fullstack Engineer at Uber, you will architect highly-performant, reliable, scalable applications used by millions of external customers every day. During the Covid19 situation, we have accelerated to build a complete virtual support experience for our customers. You will have an outstanding opportunity to build a premier and first of its kind support experience for our users. You will work closely with our internal stakeholders across all lines of business - Rides, Eats, Freight, etc. - to build and match customers with the best care channels (phone, chat, video) for their specific needs. At Uber, we have a high bar for quality & efficiency - you will collaborate closely with Product Managers and Business Operations teams to build for scale, yet solutions focused on providing delightful customer experiences. The team is focused on high business impact, where every product we ship is measured and tracked with cost savings and/or efficiency improvement.
Basic Qualifications
At least 2 years of software engineering experience
Experience coding with C++, C#, Java, Python, or Go (at least 1 required)
Experience developing web applications and good understanding of JavaScript
Strong problem solving and coding skills
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor of Science (BS) or Master of Science (MS) in Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics, or related field
Experience shipping high-quality product features on schedule
Experience building large scale distributed software systems.
Experience with SOA (micro-service) architecture.
Experience with production-quality services, deployment, monitoring, and reliability.
Experience with web application development frameworks such as NodeJS, React, Redux or similar
Experience with distributed storage (e.g. Cassandra) and relational database (e.g. MySQL) systems
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world.
We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.
Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. title: Scientist I/II, Biological Engineering - Early Pipeline Scie...
summary:
Performing literature and database surveys to evaluate project feasibility.
Competent in using statistics to strengthen experimental design and enable robust…
description:
Scientist I/II, Biological Engineering – Early Pipeline Scientist

Job Description and Responsibilities

Zymergen is hiring a scientist to join the Biological Engineering group in the Zymergen Exploration and Discovery team (ZED). This scientist will work in collaboration with the Products department on early stages Products programs prior to initiation of a full strain improvement program. This role includes working on target molecules at many stages in the early Products pipeline, from collaborating on target molecule ideation, literature evaluation of feasibility and risks, and wet-lab experiments to reduce these key program risks (e.g. stability, toxicity, pathway proof-of-concept, host selection).

The ideal candidate possesses a broad knowledge of metabolism, metabolic engineering, secondary metabolites, as well as a strong understanding of chemistry/biochemistry to be able to collaborate effectively with organic chemists and materials scientists to arrive at biological molecules which possess desired structural moieties/properties. A successful candidate would apply their knowledge of metabolic pathways and strain engineering to guide the team towards their goals.

Immediate responsibilities include:

 Performing literature and database surveys to evaluate project feasibility.
Using knowledge of microbial metabolism and phenotype analysis data to select a broad array of targets for strain improvement.
Collaborating with materials scientists and organic chemists to iterate toward optimal matches between molecular targets, application, and Zymergen capabilities.
Performing diverse wet-lab experiments aimed at evaluating or reducing
project risk prior to handoff to Development-Projects (e.g. stability, pathway proof-of-concept, host selection).

Qualifications/Experience

Must-have Skills

Hands-on, wet-lab experience with metabolic engineering of microbes for production of small molecules or genetic engineering methodologies (e.g. DNA assembly, sequencing, transformation, integration, PCR). Good understanding of cellular physiology and metabolism for a variety of eukaryotic and prokaryotic microbes, e.g. on processes associated with target molecule production, including redox metabolism, energy usage, product transport, impact on growth and health, etc.
 An understanding of cellular metabolites with ability to leverage resources to evaluate the feasibility of producing selected compounds through stain engineering.
 Effective at collaboration, enjoys working in a team, sharing work, and getting help or helping others.
Ability to work in a large groups and communicate with key stakeholders on technical feasibility and timelines of projects.
 Systematic & problem-solving approach to projects

Additional Skills of Interest

Molecular Biology and Biochemistry:
Expertise using a variety of DNA transformation techniques into both eukaryotes and prokaryotes
Skill with standard methodologies to isolate and purify proteins and characterize activities.
Target molecule production and detection:
Experience using a variety of fluorescence, spectroscopic, and chromatographic measurement techniques to detect target molecules
Familiarity with a variety of bioreactor operation modes (batch, fed batch, continuous).
Advanced Tools:
Capable of developing and/or utilizing software scripts (e.g. python, JMP, R, SQL) to handle data
Adept at utilizing automation to assist with complicated or lengthy workflows
 Competent in using statistics to strengthen experimental design and enable robust data analysis

Education: Requires Ph.D with a few years of experience or BS degree with 10+ years of relevant experience


Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. Zymergen may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills for this job.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.


Founded in 2013 and headquartered in the SF Bay Area, Zymergen is a science and material innovation company rethinking biology and reimagining the world. A World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer, Zymergen partners with nature to create never-before imagined materials and products across industries – from agriculture to consumer electronics, personal care to pharmaceuticals, and more. The company's materials are in use today, creating value for Fortune 1000 companies and major corporations across the globe. Our clients have sold over $1 billion worth of products using Zymergen microbial strains. For more information visit: www.zymergen.com.

title: Principal UI Engineer - Feature Team (Expanse)
summary:
Data volume and caching concerns.
Impact of API and database query performance on front-end experience.
Evaluate our current plans, proposals, and progress for…
description:
Company Description

Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

Your Career
We’re looking for an experienced UI engineer to join a feature team at Expanse, the latest addition to Palo Alto Networks Cortex.
Expanse helps protect some of the world’s most important organizations by finding risks on the Internet that no one else can find. Our feature teams are responsible for building the user-facing security products that allow customers to turn trillions of Internet data points into critical cybersecurity insights.
In this role, you'll help lay the groundwork to effectively hire and on-board new engineers while improving our feature velocity: a goal that requires technical knowledge & execution, critical process thinking, and consensus-building skills.
Your Impact
Evaluate our current plans, proposals, and progress for evolving Expanse’s front-end platform; you’ll propose, gain buy-in, and enact any necessary changes to our technical roadmap
Mentor other engineers:
Impart best practices through code review and pair programming
Recommend training or learning resources as necessary
Be a mentor to other team-members informally as well as through our formal Engineering Mentorship Program
Work closely with management to evaluate and refine our interview and hiring process for front-end engineers of all levels, including efficiently onboarding new hires
Help us complete our front-end platform modernization project, recommending adjustments to requirements and plans along the way to incrementally release improvements
Own and drive a part of the long-term platform technical roadmap in collaboration with your counterparts across the organization
Be a core member of a feature team, contributing to team throughput on roadmap goals; work with different teams as necessary
Partner closely with product management and UX design to shape requirements and bootstrap new projects
Initially spend the bulk of your time coding and contributing to the code base, eventually scaling back as you take on more technical leadership and mentorship activities across teams

Qualifications

Your experience
10+ years of engineering experience, with at least 2 years spent as a technical lead or senior/principal engineer: we believe that there is no substitute in this position for significant time spent in a lead role
Experience with and proven ability to technically lead large, complex projects and teams, including building functional relationships with work partners in product management and UX design
Ability to foster technical maturity in a team through institution of standards and practices as well as direct mentorship
Proven ability to collaborate effectively—this role and level explicitly require the ability to build a unified direction across stakeholders and partner teams; ideal candidates are able to clearly articulate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences, communicate constructively with colleagues, executives, and customers, and strategically adapt their communication style, frequency, and medium for maximum effectiveness
Ability to execute in, and through, a team on a large body of work by breaking it down into digestible pieces and parallelizing effort where feasible, then working with engineering and product management to orchestrate the effort efficiently
Extensive practical experience with at least one major front-end framework such as React, Vue, or Angular in a production system
Experience owning and driving front-end system architecture design, implementation, and evolution
Experience working on and supporting systems of scale, including deep understanding of:
data volume and caching concerns
impact of front-end requests on back-end systems
impact of API and database query performance on front-end experience
page load and time-to-interactive performance metrics as well as contributing factors
deployment strategies and tooling
design choices and best practices for all of the above
Additional Information

Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

title: Director Oncology Product Management, Data Products
summary: Define requirements and processes to develop database that stores all curated genomic and clinical data, including the appropriate data fields.
description:
We are looking for an experienced Director, Oncology Product Management to join the Natera Oncology Product Management team who will be responsible for our Oncology Data Product portfolio. The Director, Oncology Product Management owns the end to end product lifecycle including development of product strategy, generating requirements based on user research with our pharmaceutical and provider customers, aligning stakeholders to a roadmap, working cross-functionally with engineering, data science, medical to execute on that roadmap, and rolling out best in class products to our customers. The role combines strategic thinking with execution and will require a strong cross functional leader and influencer.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop a vision for Natera’s data product strategy internally and externally
Execute on Natera’s Oncology Data Product roadmap for Natera’s customers including Pharmaceutical companies and Oncologists
Work closely with internal and external partners to align team on execution priorities and drive clear communication
Define requirements and processes to develop database that stores all curated genomic and clinical data, including the appropriate data fields
Manage product performance and field all product support needs, working across departments, including Software Engineering, Sales & Marketing, Clinical/Medical, Operations, Regulatory, and Business Development.
Develop quantitative product performance indicators, analyze and track performance data, and identify strategies for improvement across teams.
Conduct market research, and competitive analysis as a means to test and validate product features, improve customer satisfaction and support market growth.
Support product marketing in the definition of product positioning – from market launch plans, pricing, and delivering key collateral content to marketing communications.
Create written, data-based arguments and presentations to achieve buy-in from stakeholders
This role works with PHI on a regular basis both in paper and electronic form and has an access to various technologies to access PHI (paper and electronic) in order to perform the job.
Employee must complete training relating to HIPAA/PHI privacy, General Policies and Procedure Compliance training and security training as soon as possible but not later than the first 30 days of hire.
Must maintain a current status on Natera training requirements.
Employee must pass post offer criminal background check.


QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a science or engineering discipline. Master’s degree preferred
7+ years of product management experience with significant track record of driving customer impact
Experience with healthcare data products preferred
Prior enterprise product ownership a plus
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Provide a list of technical or behavioral knowledge, skills, and/or abilities.
Technical: Evaluates an applicant's acquired knowledge and specific technical skills.
Behavioral: Evaluates factors related to human characteristics and skills, such as attitude, work approach and collaborative abilities.
Ability to lead and motivate a cross-functional team
Ability to understand technology and articulate customer value/benefit propositions
Basic financial/economic modeling skills
Proven excellence in both written and oral communications skill
Must be able to collaborate and interact effectively with individuals, and influence individuals, across functional areas and in team environments
Proven organizational skills and extraordinary attention to detail, with ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously


PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT:
This position requires the ability to use a computer keyboard, communicate over the telephone and read printed material. Duties may require working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends) at times.]
Duties are typically performed in an office setting.

We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

title: Housing Navigator
summary:
In partnership with the Housing Services Coordinator, create and maintain a landlord listing database.
Maintain a database of all clients housed including date…
description:
Program Description
A Pathway to Housing for Homeless Veterans – join a team that assists Veteran families experiencing homelessness to attain housing placement and housing stability. BFHP is expanding on our successful Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) Roads Home program to connect very low-income homeless individuals and families with permanent housing. The program provides street and venue-based outreach, case management, permanent housing placement, temporary financial assistance, employment assistance, and assistance in obtaining VA and other benefits. The program will work with all participants to develop and carry out action plans that improve their health and wellness.
Position Summary
The Housing Navigator supports the Roads Home Program’s effort through landlord engagement, retention, and collaboration with other housing agencies. The Housing Navigator is the liaison for all landlords and property management personnel and the Roads Home program and its clients. This position acts as a housing advocate for Veteran households by negotiating housing options on behalf of Veteran households in enrolled in the Roads Home program. The position will support Veteran households in complying with housing rules through various tenant rights education and life skill trainings.
Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesIn partnerships with the Housing Services Coordinator, build relationships with landlords in the Counties Roads Home serves.In partnership with the Housing Services Coordinator, create and maintain a landlord listing database.Match landlord qualifications with client needs.Perform or arrange housing inspections prior to move-in.Negotiate rental agreements with landlords, conduct housing inspections, and assist participants with review of lease agreements and move-ins.Collect and keep files of income certifications, calculations of subsidies and lease approvals for participants’ direct lease contracts.Maintain a database of all clients housed including date and location of permanent housing.Conduct regular home visits to clients who are housed.Ensure that all regulatory agreements, contracts, and fair housing laws are met as they relate to housing.Provide program participants with the housing resources needed to reach their permanent housing goals.Provide individual and in group education regarding housing retention, tenancy skills and money management.Coordinate eviction prevention services and follow up with landlords.Adhere to laws regarding confidentiality and reporting requirements; maintain knowledge of current HIPAA certification standards.Have a clear understanding of PTSD, Traumatic Brain Injury, alcohol and drug dependency and other mental health issues.Assist with the client intake process and initial assessment; create and maintain new client files electronically as needed.In partnership with the Case Manager, assist clients in meeting basic needs for food, shelter, medical /mental health care, ID’s, etc, as needed.Document all services provided through HMIS data base, including client intakes, program entry and program exit.Participate in weekly department staff meetings and case conferences.Some weekend and evening hours may be required.Perform other related duties as required by supervisor.Work within the framework of the agency’s Code of Conduct.Exercise responsibility appropriate to the positions and delegated authorities.Be responsible to everyone else, the agency and its stakeholders both for your actions and your decisions not to act.Conduct business in accordance with the BFHP Employee Handbook, exercising sound judgment and serving the best interests of the agency and the community.Commit yourself to treating each community member with respect and dignity.
Qualifications, Skills, and AbilitiesBachelor’s Degree in Social Welfare, Business or related field; or three years of direct experience in real-estate, property management, or housing support.Commitment and knowledge of issues related to homelessness, veterans, mental health.Excellent knowledge of local housing markets in the Counties Roads Home serves.Ability and comfort with conducting single staffed home visits.Capacity to set priorities in consultation with supervisor.Good conflict resolution skills.Ability to meet deadlines and complete multiple tasks in a timely manner.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Ability to maintain professional conduct, attitude and appearance at all times.Capacity to work independently and as part of a team.Proficiency on PC computers, Windows, Microsoft Suite and databases, and ability to perform word processing, data entry, and other tasks at a computer work station.Ability to use a reliable personal vehicle for travel to staff meetings, meetings with landlords and other community members, meetings with clients, and to conduct home visits.Ability to work some weekends and evenings as needed.Veterans given preference in all SSVF hiring;
Special RequirementsThis position requires frequent driving. A valid California driver license, reliable personal vehicle, current personal auto insurance as required by law, and an MVR sufficient to obtain and reasonably maintain insurability under agency auto liability policies.Must be able to obtain background clearance.May be required to lift or move up to 50 lbs.
We are extremely proud of our diverse team and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Business Planning & Operations Manager
summary: Experienced in using Excel spreadsheets for running data analysis and building quantitative models with complexity for business decision making.
description:
Facebook is seeking a Manager to join the North America Business Planning and Operations team (BP&O). The mission of the Global Business Planning and Operations group is to maximize business performance by being the objective and trusted partner to the sales organization – through strategic planning, cross-functional collaboration and operational excellence. We also identify and drive critical projects and strategic initiatives to support revenue growth. This role will lead a team of two to provide revenue insights for sales leadership with ongoing operational rhythm as well as establish analytical modeling and tooling solutions in close partnership with global teams, and/or lead NA planning process to ensure clear strategic priorities, go-to-market service model, adequate resourcing and execution accountability across NA Sales teams. You will be passionate about Facebook, interested in advertising, intellectually curious, a fast learner, analytical and data-driven, process and structure oriented, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment, able to focus on the details while thinking strategically, while investing in coaching and developing talents on the team.
People management: Build a high-performing team and coach a team of analysts and program manager to deliver business performance insights and leverage analytics to drive business priorities that are highly visible to sales executives on ongoing basis
Stakeholder and partner relationship: Serve as a go-to trusted business partner for sales executives, develop strong collaborative relationships across North America and Global BP&O teams to drive analytical and/or planning initiatives
Business insights: Use data-driven approach to generate analytical insights across market, industry, and advertiser performance, including leading performance indicators, product adoption, tentpole events, sales productivity and efficiency, forecasting accuracy and so on, which inform executives and management of revenue upside opportunity and risks as well as strategic priorities progress to take proactive actions on
Operational optimization: Design, optimize and execute on standard cadence of operations to deliver revenue insights (e.g., weekly reporting, monthly and quarterly business review) with operational efficiency and strong control
Modeling and tooling efficiency: Establish a system of analytical tools (e.g., excel models, dashboards) and off-the-shelf data resources by influencing and leveraging global infrastructure where available and streamlining North America team’s analytical infrastructure
Project management: Initiate and support analytics, tooling and planning projects at regional or global level
Strategic planning: Design and flawlessly execute on annual planning process in partnership with key cross-functional partners, drive thoughtful strategy and resource budgeting plans (e.g., headcount) across teams
BA/BS in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business or related field)
8+ years of work experience involving analytical rigor as typically seen in, but not restricted to, functions like finance, business operations, data analytics, etc. or industries like consulting, banking, etc.
Program Management and Operations experience working independently, managing multiple concurrent processes and projects, and driving initiatives in a cross-functional environment
Problem solving and analysis experience solving business problems (commercial, operational, organizational) using large database and qualitative information from various sources
Experience presenting business and technical content to senior stakeholders, peers and general audiences
Communication experience with story-telling and presentations utilizing tools such as PowerPoint and Google Slides
Experienced in using Excel spreadsheets for running data analysis and building quantitative models with complexity for business decision making. Experience with, as typically seen in, but not restricted to, pivot table based reporting, using charts for visualization and use of lookup and math functions
Experience building and managing relationships with cross-functional partners and stakeholders
Experience working in or with Digital media, internet or technology industry, or willingness to learn about these domain
Experience in people management
Technical skill and experience with SQL, Tableau
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

You will be passionate about Facebook, interested in advertising, intellectually curious, a fast learner, analytical and data-driven .'}]

title: Case Manager - Centers of Excellence (COE)
location: San Francisco, CA 94103 (South of Market area)
summary: Administration:: Maintain client progress notes in the electronic medical record (Epic) and enter data in AIDS Regional Information & Evaluation System (ARIES).
description:
Organizational Summary :

Since 1982 San Francisco AIDS Foundation has been fighting to eliminate HIV transmission and to improve the quality and length of lives for people living with HIV. While progress has been substantial, our work is far from complete. More than 25,000 people every year access free HIV testing and STI screening, harm reduction and syringe access and disposal, community engagement, and health navigation services from SFAF. We need passionate agents of social change, vanguards of public health, and creative problem-solvers to join our fight.

San Francisco AIDS Foundation (SFAF) envisions a future where health justice is achieved for all people living with or at risk for HIV. Ultimately, SFAF strives for a day when:
Race is not a barrier to health and wellness
Substance use is not stigmatized
HIV status does not determine quality of life
HIV transmission is eliminated.
The newly approved San Francisco AIDS Foundation strategic plan includes an articulation of its five key values:, which are the foundation for its work and its employees: Justice, Dignity, Courage, Leadership and Excellence. :

Position Overview::
This case management position focuses on providing services for patients at the SFGH HIV clinic, Ward 86. This position functions within a team of case managers and provides intensive case management to “high need” HIV+ clients who are dual-diagnosed in the areas of mental health and substance abuse. This position is a hybrid counselor and case manager position, with emphasis on case management, to assist clients in removing barriers to HIV wellness goals, specifically HIV viral suppression. The focus is on providing counseling and case management services to assist the client in successfully engaging with and maintaining medical care and treatment, with a special focus on medication adherence.

This position is in-person, and adequate supply of PPE and training in COVID-19 safety protocols is provided by SFAF and all institutional partners in collaboration with the Centers of Excellence programs.:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities::

Case management:: Develop and maintain a clinically appropriate working relationship with the client to help link them to needed services, resources and opportunities. Provide psychosocial assessment of each client every 6 months to reevaluate the needs of the client and make referrals as needed.
Consultation:: Work within a multidisciplinary team, including San Francisco General Hospital social workers, nurses, primary care physicians, and mental health teams via case conferences, verbal consultations, and progress notes in the electronic database (Epic).
Outreach:: Collaborate with other agencies, case managers and medical providers to achieve common goals of our mission, values and strategic plan through meetings, trainings and other events.
Counseling:: Provide individual and group counseling; substance abuse counseling to be delivered within the framework of the harm reduction philosophy. The main emphasis will be on providing health education to clients regarding HIV disease, especially the importance of medical care and treatment adherence. Provide crisis management to clients as needed.
Administration:: Maintain client progress notes in the electronic medical record (Epic) and enter data in AIDS Regional Information & Evaluation System (ARIES). Prepares and maintains client clinical charts.


Essential Qualifications:::
Communication:: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated ability to manage responsibilities and meet deadlines. Awareness and sensitivity to health disparities as well as stigma related to SFAF’s priority communities.
Knowledge:: Possesses technical knowledge required to do the job. Ability to maintain confidentiality. Knowledge of the harm reduction model, drug and alcohol counseling and other therapeutic models and interventions. Knowledge of traditional case management duties of psychosocial needs assessment and connecting the client to needed resources.
Judgment:: Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; can clearly explain reasoning for decisions; includes appropriate people in decision-making process; demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles.
Adaptability: :Adapts to changes in work duties and organizational structure.
Problem Solving:: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; works with others to solve complex problems
Customer Service:: Ability to work comfortably with many different communities and stakeholders; exhibits sensitivity to issues concerning HIV. Responds efficiently and cordially to requests for service and assistance.
Autonomy: :Experience and comfort working in a hospital/medical environment in an independent, proactive fashion.
Professionalism:: Reacts well under pressure; treats others with respect and consideration; follows through on commitments.
Dependability:: Completes tasks on time; takes responsibility for own actions; reliable.
Computer Skills:: Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
Professional Expectations:: Demonstrated ability to fulfill the Foundation’s professional expectations of accountability, active collaboration, commitment, communication, and professionalism.


Supervision::: No supervisory duties

Physical Requirements and Work Environments:::

Skill in operating equipment such as a personal computer, copy machine and telephone system. Ability to perform routine bending, stooping, twisting, and reaching. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Education and Experience:: :
3 years of case management experience required.
Bachelor’s degree desired.
Master’s degree in social work, psychology or related field highly regarded.
Understanding of HIV treatment, transmission and risk factors highly regarded.
Experience working with HIV+ clients highly regarded.
Experience working in a multidisciplinary medical setting highly regarded.

This position will have access to protected health information (PHI) and may only access, use or disclose the minimum information necessary to perform their designated role on behalf of San Francisco AIDS Foundation, regardless of the extent of access provided.


For candidates who are eligible and interested, clinical supervision hours towards licensure is available with this position.

Work Environment:::

This position is primarily located at 1035 Market Street; San Francisco, however will require traveling to other office locations or off-site meetings as required by the job, especially at Ward 86 at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital.


This position is in-person, and adequate supply of PPE and training in COVID-19 safety protocols is provided by SFAF and all institutional partners in collaboration with the Centers of Excellence programs.:

This position will have access to protected health information (PHI) and may only access, use or disclose the minimum information necessary to perform their designated role on behalf of San Francisco AIDS Foundation, regardless of the extent of access provided.

The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for personnel so classified.


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:::

The San Francisco AIDS Foundation is an Equal Opportunity employer. We actively seek applications from people living with HIV/AIDS, people with disabilities, women, LGBTQ individuals and people of color.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.



Application Process:::
Please visit our careers page at:

http://www.sfaf.org/about-us/careers/

POSITION OPEN UNTIL FILLED:
NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE:

More than 25,000 people every year access free HIV testing and STI screening, harm reduction and syringe access and disposal, community engagement, and health navigation services from SFAF .'}]

title: Senior Data Product Manager
summary: Person will collaborate with the platform, data science and engineering team in developing data solutions that could be leveraged in decision making.
description:
Company Description

About
Together we make. Come make with us.
Overview
About us.
At Cricut®, we believe that we’re all born makers. When we built our first cutting machine, we saw the potential for a simple yet powerful tool to completely transform the way people craft, design, and DIY. Since then, we continue to innovate with new machines, platforms, materials, and tools, but that’s just what we do. Who we are is a bustling worldwide community, a means for connection, and an outlet for unbridled creativity. Join us as we place the power of handmade into the hands of ALL.
Life
Love your work. And your coworkers.
Our company is made up of A+ human beings. We ask tough questions, entertain ideas outside of our own, and work together to make something bigger than ourselves. With Cricut® growing in China, the U.K., Australia, New Zealand, as well as Europe and South America, we’re on an unstoppable roll, satisfying that innate creative itch around the world. We train, develop, and celebrate great work with hallway high fives and promotions within. We also throw the world’s best Halloween party.
Enjoy incredible perks.
We take care of our team. From outstanding medical, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, to pet insurance, 401K match, life insurance, incentive programs, paid time off, on-site massages, phenomenal work-life balance, and employee discounts, we offer the best benefits package in the DIY consumer electronics industry. Period.
Like what you see? We can’t wait to meet you.

Job Description

This position will lead integration of customer data sources, building customer intelligence and create customer C360 profile. Person will be responsible to drive activation of Customer Intelligence across different channels e.g. marketing, customer service, Design studio and ecommerce.
Person will collaborate with the platform, data science and engineering team in developing data solutions that could be leveraged in decision making. This is just as much a business role as it is a technical one.

Qualifications

We are looking for highly talented team members who are passionate about data, have the rigor needed to solve billion dollar problems, and possess an innate entrepreneurial spirit to explore the uncharted. This team combines the engineering backbone of a best-in-class Big Data Platform with the analytic expertise of advanced mining and predictive modeling.
If you want to work among the very best talent in the industry, working on the most innovative products in the world, Cricut is the place to be.
Responsibilities:
Build Data Science Products: Build innovative Data Science products that ‘democratize’ business teams access to data.
Data Quality & Governance: Build right data assessment framework, governance & privacy processes to ensure 100% compliances with CCPA
Understanding of big data Ecosystem: It is essential that this role has an understanding of a broad range of topics required to run a best-in-class Customer data platform. This includes the knowledge of data quality, ID mapping, Analytical modules, Predictive modeling, Data Governance and Reporting.
Business co-ordination: Since the Customer data platform will be the ‘single source of truth’ about customers for all teams across Cricut, it involves a fair bit of internal co-ordination. This person is expected to understanding business challenges, conduct feasibility study and execute tasks in a timely manner
Measurement & A/B testing: Build relevant KPIs to monitor the effectiveness of data science models. Create a test and learn culture to unlock value and drive continuous improvement.
Self Service tools: Conceptualize and develop self-service platform for business teams to do adhoc analysis
Actionable Insights: Develop strategies and provide direction for the application of Business Intelligence tools that provide robust KPI's and drill down capabilities to find actionable insights
Desired background / skills / mindset:
Background:
Graduate or bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, etc.)
4+ years of professional experience in customer analytics, marketing analytics or related field in a quantitative role
Direct experience with using customer data in e-commerce, technology would be preferred
Skills:
Succinct, proactive communication; storytelling using data
Proven experience in managing multiple tasks simultaneously with a rigid determination to meet deadlines
Comfortable to work with people from a broad range of backgrounds from highly technical to marketing to sales/business
Very strong analytical skills
Understanding of machine learning algorithms
Strong in SQL Skills
Strong project management skills
Understanding of A/B testing frameworks
Mindset:
Self-starter mentality with the ability to deliver results
Focused on results and their implications (rather than methods/tools/process)
Comfortable reprioritizing as situations change to maximize our impact
Openness to work with different cultures and working styles
Additional Information

At Cricut, we celebrate inclusion and diversity. Cricut is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions based on merit. Cricut prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Cricut participates in E-Verify.
What to Do Next: Please attach your resume, cover letter (feel free to include links to your social presence). If you want to show your superpowers in other ways – include that information too. You can be sure that Cricut® is an employer who values individuality, equality and diversity, so tell us what you’re all about. If you are a Maker or a DIY enthusiast, whether you think you are a good one or not, we would love to hear about it when you send us your information.

title: Procurement Manager
summary:
Highly proficient with database systems and ERP programs.
Ability to lead a team and foster a data-driven performance culture.
description:
EO Products is a company with one mission and two brands: to create healthy personal care products that nurture the people who use them, respect the people who make them, and honor the planet we all share. We work hard to ensure our values come to life in each bottle of EO® and Everyone for Every Body® products.
We have been family owned, operated, and independent since 1995. We call Northern California home and manufacture our essential oil-based products in-house at our certified organic factory and HQ. You can find us at Whole Foods, Sprouts, Target, Walmart, Amazon, and many other retailers throughout the US and in 11 other countries.
We’re a certified B Corp, meaning we are a for-profit business that operates like a nonprofit. B Lab recognizes EO Products as a company that prioritizes people, planet, purpose, and profit — in that order.
We are a diverse and passionate team of free-thinking, soap-loving individuals.
PROCUREMENT MANAGER:
The Procurement Manager is responsible for managing supplier relationships, negotiating landed costs within ranges to achieve targeted margin goals, and securing supply of goods per the demand planning schedule. This position will also be leading the research and onboarding of new suppliers for goods and services per product specification guidelines.
This role is responsible for scheduling product supply, including raw material and outsourced manufacturing, in accordance with SKU-level monthly sales forecasting to ensure adherence to company order fill rate goals. This involves planning consigned & directed-buy material supply to ensure uninterrupted MFG scheduling while maintaining inventory turn rates in accordance with corporate goals.
The Procurement Manager will provide day-to-day leadership, skill development and strategic guidance to a small team of buyers. This role will work closely with Quality, R&D and Product Development Departments on new product launches, new ingredients, and supplier onboarding.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Procurement

Negotiates pricing and delivery of multi-category items to achieve COGS and inventory turn goals.
In partnership with Product Development and R&D, sources new suppliers for both existing and new items. Works closely with Quality Department on vendor qualification.
Ensures the delivery of required product and vendor documentation to Regulatory and Quality departments, assists with maintaining the databases for these documents.
Maintains and creates sources of market intel to help drive strategic procurement decisions based upon business disruption avoidance and landed-cost advantage.
Searches for opportunities to shorten the distance between points of supply and points of delivery.
Works closely with the Distribution team to identify the most cost-effective and time efficient method of material movements.
Advocates for sustainable packaging and ingredient solutions – includes origin point, PCR content, delivery method, processing methods, vendor partner sustainability initiatives, etc.
Leads contract negotiations against established baseline volume requirements, and establishes pricing & volume intel to drive negotiation goals.
Stays updated on supplier capacity constraints, and develops strategies to mitigate risk.
Creates and implements Vendor Scorecards to identify areas of opportunity for improvement.
Establishes core relationships with outsourced manufacturing partners to schedule activity in accordance with partner specialty, optimal quantity & delivery frequency.
Utilizes forward-looking calendar to establish timing of inbound finished goods in accordance with safety stock buffer and fill rate goals.
In tandem with our ERP Specialist, develops MRP tools to drive the procurement process.
Establishes a training schedule with procurement team to coach new skills, create new SOP’s and refresh existing SOP’s.
Executes on time-sensitive deliverables for New Product Launch activities.
Integrates the Distribution and Warehouse group into inbound product supply for the purpose of optimizing space and inventory movements.
Leads team analysis and management of inventory turns by category, and works with the Inventory control team to address slow/non-moving categories.
Other
Maintains existing and develops new KPI’s and performance reporting related to inventory management for the Supply Chain Manager.
Develops the Buying team, guides both day-to-day tactics and a strategic long-term procurement mindset.
SKILLS REQUIRED:
Bachelors degree in closely related field
10+ years of experience in supply chain
5+ years of experience managing a team
Advanced ERP system skillset
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel or Sheets
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Advanced interpersonal skills and ability to interact with people at all levels
Integrity and discretion in dealing with confidential information
Highly proficient with database systems and ERP programs
Extensive knowledge of supply chain, distribution and manufacturing
Ability to review legal documents, specification sheets, and other technical documentation
Ability to lead a team and foster a data-driven performance culture
We offer a fun, casual place to work & grow, vacation, medical, dental, matching 401k, profit sharing bonus and employee discounts. Our company culture values responsibility, collaboration, integrity and passion. We've been named Best Places to Work by the North Bay Business Journal. Learn how we ensure our work is love made visible at www.eoproducts.com/pages/about-us.

title: Informatics Technical Advisor, Global Health
summary:
Additionally, the individual will be responsible for data analysis as needed.
Integrating health informatics into all projects to create platforms for data…
description:
The Global Health Informatics Technical Advisor is a vital role to the strategic growth of the health informatics portfolio in Global Strategic Information (GSI). It is increasingly critical that health information is collected at the clinical level with ease, ensuring high quality data. This information must be easily accessible at the clinic, local, regional and national levels. Integrating health informatics into all projects to create platforms for data collection, analysis, and use allows the appropriate staff to use and interpret the data to improve programs and ultimately improve patient outcomes. Furthermore, health informatics may be able to solve health problems that cannot be solved in any other way, for example tracking lab specimens between sites. This position will be integrally involved in all GSI health informatics projects and will lead and support current projects, as well as pursue new opportunities for funding and expansion.

This Informatics Technical Advisor will be supervised by the GSI Technical Director for Global Health Informatics. To be successful in this position, the candidate must be an experienced professional who knows how to apply theory and put it into practice with in-depth understanding of the professional field; independently performs the full range of responsibilities within the function; possesses broad job knowledge; analyzes problems/issues of diverse scope and determines solutions.

Specifically, the Informatics Technical Advisor will provide technical oversight of informatics-related aspects of UCSF GSI projects, such as innovative data collection systems, data warehousing, and dashboard development with tools such as Power BI. Additionally, this position will lead the development and implementation of international health messaging standards (FHIR, HL7 etc.), standardized terminologies, health information exchanges, master patient indices and deduplication/linkage of clients. Depending on time and project portfolio, the candidate may be responsible for the direct implementation of some of these projects. The person will furthermore provide technical assistance (TA), training and mentorship to beneficiaries of CDC-funded projects, such as host governments, local and regional governments, implementing partners and universities – based on TA requests. When needed, the person will lead the recruitment of additional informatics capacity for specific projects and provide technical oversight and supervision. Additionally, the individual will be responsible for data analysis as needed.

Additionally, this person will utilize project management frameworks and methods to manage health information system projects, as well as provide technical support across GSI projects. The person will lead the writing of grant applications, with particular attention given to technical health information sections and budgets, compose quarterly and annual reports, and scopes of work for health informatics projects. The successful candidate will be able to manage projects of diverse scope, size, impact budget and project team size.

This is a full-time one-year contract position ending on 3/31/2022, with likelihood of extension based on funding.
Department Description
UCSF’s Institute for Global Health Sciences (IGHS) is dedicated to improving health and reducing the burden of disease in the world's most vulnerable populations. It integrates UCSF expertise in all of the health, social, and biological sciences, and focuses that expertise on pressing issues in global health. IGHS works with partners in countries throughout the world to achieve these aims. Global Strategic Information (GSI), a group within IGHS, is primarily funded by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to provide expertise in the area of global HIV prevention.

IGHS is committed to ensuring a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment as we work towards becoming an anti-racist organization. We strongly encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds. Please see our statement on anti-racism here: https://globalhealthsciences.ucsf.edu/about-us/diversity-equity-and-inclusion/statement-structural-racism
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in related area and 3+ years of related experience; and/or equivalent experience/trainingRequires basic knowledge of project management principles, theories, and conceptsDemonstratable experience with software and database development, or software development project management using open source technologiesExpertise in principles, practices, and concepts of public health, epidemiology, management, data management and statisticsExperience in leading, managing, developing or implementing standards-based interoperability for health information systems (HL7, FHIR, HIE, SNOMED, LOINC)Ability to conduct effective trainings on technological issues, new systems for groups ranging from 10-50 peopleDemonstrated advanced organization and project management skills, including experience hiring and supervising staff on technical projectsRequires effective communication skills with a broad range of project members, including investigators, statisticians, programmers and administrative staff, as well as with CDC personnel across diverse cultures. Effective organization skillsDemonstrated attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to determine relevance and prioritize tasksDemonstrated competency in selecting and implementing project management methods and techniquesEffective skill at tracking effort and project progressProven leadership ability. Effective problem-solving skills. Ability to work with limited supervision and guidance
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in computer science, health informatics, public health, epidemiology, biostatistics or other relevant fieldCoursework and/or degree in public health, epidemiology or biostatisticsProfessional certificationExpertise and demonstrable experience in: R, SQL Programming, Power BI/Tableau, master patient indices, matching algorithmsExperience in managing health informatics activities in multiple countriesKnowledge of international public health programs, primarily PEPFAR funded projects
About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.
Pride Values
UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.


In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu


Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Assistant/Associate Adjunct Faculty in Business Analytics - OPS 803.01 Data Management Technology - Spring Quarter 2021

Location: Online
Open Date: Feb 1, 2021
Deadline:


Description:Founded in 1863, Saint Mary's is a residential campus nestled 20 miles east of San Francisco in the picturesque Moraga Valley. Based in the Catholic, Lasallian and Liberal Arts traditions, Saint Mary's currently enrolls more than 4,000 students from diverse backgrounds in undergraduate and graduate programs. The De La Salle Christian Brothers, the largest teaching order of the Roman Catholic Church, guide the spiritual and academic character of the College.

As a comprehensive and independent institution, Saint Mary's offers undergraduate and graduate programs integrating liberal and professional education. Saint Mary's reputation for excellence, innovation, and responsiveness in education stems from its vibrant heritage as a Catholic, Lasallian and Liberal Arts institution. An outstanding, committed faculty and staff that value shared inquiry, integrative learning, and student interaction bring these traditions to life in the 21st century. The College is committed to the educational benefits of diversity.


Qualifications:
OPS 803.01, Data Management Technology


Spring Quarter, 4/17/2021-6/19/2021, Every Saturday 1:30 PM to 5:30PM, Course Modality: 100% Online. Applicant must reside in California.

This course prepares students to effectively manage data through database theory and tools. Topics include relational database structure, database queries and reports, and database management issues such as concurrency control, data security and integrity. Structured Query Language (SQL) and a structured database software package will be used in the course.

Qualifications

Ph.D. degree in Business Analytics or a closely related field and a recent publication record in the field, OR
A Masters degree in Business Analytics or a closely related field and five years of current, relevant professional experience.


To apply, visit https://apply.interfolio.com/83626

title: Software Engineer
summary:
2+ years of experience in data architecture and strategy.
4+ years relational database management system (RDBMS) experience.
2+ years of e-commerce experience.
description:
Job Description

Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as 'Personal Cell' or 'Cellular' in the contact information of your application.
At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Wells Fargo Technology is a team of more than 40,000 information technology and security professionals who help keep Wells Fargo at the forefront of America's diversified financial services companies. Employees execute an engineering-led IT strategy to deliver stable, secure, scalable and innovative services that provide Wells Fargo global customers ‘round-the-clock' banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels. Wells Fargo Technology plays a critical role in the company's customer and employee experience, business and risk management transformation, and growth agenda.
The Digital Technology and Innovation group (DTI) supports the Corporate Strategy, Digital Platform & Innovation Business. Together they work closely to continue evolving Wells Fargo's digital platforms and enhance integration of the innovation pipeline into our customer-facing capabilities.
DTI's WWW/Public Site platform is seeking a Software Engineer with special analyst skills for Public Site development group. WWW platform hosts multiple customer-facing applications with a wide variety of J2EE applications. This platform is fast-growing with new applications getting added along with enhancements to existing applications.
This Software Engineer role requires a unique combination of skills and passion for our customers, with deep knowledge of the business and technical domains. This role requires analytical and communication skills enabling the resource to work collaboratively with the business across technical and business domains to help come up with the best solution to meet their needs. The person in this role is a key driver in positioning the WWW platform to support strategic business initiatives and will act as a team lead. Advanced skills and experience as a developer, mastery of various technologies and creativity will be used extensively in the implementation of various projects in this platform.
Selected candidate will be required to work within the following Wells Fargo location: 333 Market Street San Francisco CA 94105. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.
This is a full time opportunity with a competitive compensation package to include the following: Comprehensive benefits including a generous PTO program, 401-K match and many other benefits. To learn more about our benefits visit https://www.wellsfargo.com/about/careers/benefits/

2+ years of retail banking experience

3+ years of web applications experience
4+ years of JMS (Java Message Service) experience
5+ years of Java experience

5+ years of Spring experience
3 + years of experience with Agile tools
3+ years of Application Security experience
5+ years of software engineering experience

Knowledge and understanding of technology object oriented: design patterns and their application
Knowledge and understanding of technology support: troubleshooting environments across the entire architecture (applications to infrastructure)
Wells Fargo home lending technology experience
2+years of Mongo DB experience
Knowledge and understanding of hardware and infrastructure concepts
4+ years relational database management system (RDBMS) experience
3 + years of experience developing web applications utilizing HTML 5
5+ years of JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) development experience
Experience delivering complex enterprise wide information technology solutions
Knowledge and understanding of Cloud computing, PaaS design principles and micro services and containers
Experience Hadoop ecosystem tools relevant for real-time and batch data ingestion, processing and provisioning using tools such as Apache Flume, Apache Kafka, Apache Sqoop, Apache Flink, Apache Hive or Apache Storm
2+ years of experience in data architecture and strategy
1+ year of experience with in-memory databases such as Redis, MongoDB, or Cassandra
2+ years of experience designing and developing low-latency, memory-intensive, high-volume customer-facing retail banking applications
Ability to motivate a team and lead strategic initiatives, collaborating across a large organization and multi-tasking as required
4+ years of GitHub experience
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
An industry-standard technology certification

Other Desired Qualifications

title: Business Development Mgr (US-WEST) - AWS Marketplace
summary: Analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight to drive customer adoption and make appropriate…
description:
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of business development roles with quota, strategic analysis, or program/product management experience
3+ years selling technology (software and/or services) related to one of the following software categories: security, networking, dev/ops, database, storage, business intelligence or media to Enterprise organizations

AWS Marketplace is looking for a Business Development Manager (BDM) who will drive the adoption of AWS Marketplace with “Buyers” by working with the sellers on marketplace and collaborating with AWS Account teams to ensure products and solutions land at our customers. Primary BDM responsibilities include driving the Procurement and IT relationships around the MP programs and platform. The technical solutions include security, networking, devops, database, storage, business intelligence, ML, IoT owning the day-to-day interactions with existing customers Enterprise accounts to identify needs met through AWS MP. The BDM will align with the MP extended teams to build scale for our field facing programs and will be part of a team that serves as trusted advisor to the area sales leadership and liaison to various internal teams.

AWS Marketplace brings Amazon's e-commerce expertise to cloud software and is fundamentally change how software is discovered, deployed and consumed on AWS. To learn more, please visit https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace

Roles & Responsibilities:

Works with AWS Sales and Solution Architects to meet or exceed assigned AWS Marketplace revenue goals
Acts as a liaison from MP for the AWS Field sales team they are aligned to as well as the extended MP team for field and Independent Software Vendors (ISV) facing programs that align to Americas.
Manages the sales adoption cycle of an opportunity and will partner with various teams to develop, propose and close new business through AWS Marketplace
Engages in senior level customer meetings to discuss customer’s business issues and explores how the Marketplace features and programs can help address and resolve these issues
Establish ways to measure and track metrics related to adoption of AWS Marketplace products, and to make improvements to the approach based on those measurements
Prepare and deliver business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics for the area
Educate and enable the sales teams and increase visibility of AWS Marketplace products across all relevant AWS teams
Handle a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market.

Life/work balance

Our team is focused on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy and by prioritizing solutions and processes that enable us to scale faster than the business. There will be opportunities to work from home some days, as you will be traveling around 50% of the time with this role. Work hours can be flexible and typically self-defined. Other candidate locations in the West will be evaluated.

Mentorship and Career Growth

One of the keys to AWS’s success is its top-tier product management culture. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple AWS business lines that can help you accelerate your career and bring ideas to market. You will be working closely with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Marketplace Product Management & Engineering, AWS field teams, AWS Services (e.g. S3, EC2), migration teams, services, legal, operations and support).

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Working with a team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results is exciting. Partnering with others in the organization is key to our long term success and is what helps frame our inclusive culture.


MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
Experience selling to Enterprise organizations
Experience with cloud computing related fields (IT, software, etc.)
Analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business
Experience with, and detailed knowledge of the Partner Channel ecosystem and insights related to cloud computing
Local Business Contacts within assigned sales region
Ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Software Engineer II – Assortment
summary:

description:
About Gap Inc.
Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.
This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.
About the role
As a team member of the Design-Develop-Assort-Source-Book organization, we’re looking for a Software Engineer who has the capability to lead a DevOps product team through the requirements gathering, design, development, deployment, and support phases of a product. This role will design highly scalable and high performing technology solutions in an Agile work environment and produce and deliver code and/or test cases using Agile practices. This individual will work closely with business support teams and product managers to assist in resolving critical production issues and improve business processes through the latest in technology and automation.
This individual will need to stay current on the latest in technology and methodology in the market and be able to perform proof of concepts to better understand how they fit into the Gap landscape and to apply usefulness and effectiveness to the organization upon adoption. The role is responsible for technical and architecture implementation against the agreed scope and quality of the end product delivered. The key business partners that works closely with this team member are the Product Architect, Technical Manager, Product Manager and Scrum Master in order to balance product architecture and to meet the delivery timeline.
What you'll do
Partner with product management, technical management, and architecture in the design of software products.
Write well-written, self-documenting code that follows best practices and design patterns.
Design, implement and launch highly-visible features for our Global Supply Chain platform.
Partner with like-minded engineers in empowered and self-organized product teams.
Lead, follow and teach others during the development of software.
Practice relentless automation, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Develop, test, deploy, and support software in the Azure cloud that supports business needs.
Who you are
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
7+ years professional software development experience
5+ years of experience in the design, development, deployment, and support of PowerBI Reports as well as relational database solutions involving stored procedures and SQL Server Integration Services.
3+ years of experiencing developing with Azure Data Factory as well as deploying and supporting Azure Cloud-based solutions
Experience with data warehouse and big data integration
Hands-on experience in the DevOps model, production support and Agile methodologies as well as understanding the concepts Test-Driven Development and Business-Driven Development
Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills and proven ability to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative data
Notice to applicants in San Francisco: Gap Inc. and its related brands will consider for employment, qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. The Fair Chance Ordinance is provided here: English Spanish Chinese Tagalog
Benefits at Gap Inc.
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.

summary:
Experience working with a relational database, preferably PL/SQL.
Stay current with data engineering best practices and promote new techniques as internal…
description:
Look for more than answers.
Patients and Physicians rely on our diagnostic testing, information and services to help them make better healthcare decisions. These are often serious decisions with far reaching consequences, and require sensitivity, tact and a clear dedication to service. It’s about providing clarity and hope.
As a Science Software Engineer, you will work for the world leader in the industry, with a career where you will have the opportunity to collaborate and affect change while expanding your leadership skills and technical knowledge. You can make a real impact in a market that is growing and developing.
This is a virtual/remote position. The ideal candidate will be located in the greater San Francisco Bay area and will have the ability to travel to meetings ~1x/month.
Science Software Engineer – the role:
You will work in the bioinformatics team, supporting the analysis and data processing of clinical DNA sequencing results from patient samples. Your work will support providing diagnostic, prognostic and relevant treatment information to patients and their treating physicians. Activities may be individual projects or assignments within a project team, often working closely with other Software Developers, R&D bench scientists, Genetic Counselors, Operations Scientists, and other technical business partners. Your role will be to contribute to the design, implementation and acceptance of state-of-the-art applications that support these processes.
Job responsibilities:
Build and maintain applications and APIs for on-prem and cloud deployment that process data from Quest’s sequencing tests.
Consult on process and technology improvement efforts within R&D, Operations, and IT departments.
Stay current with data engineering best practices and promote new techniques as internal subject matter expert.
Adhere to software development best practices
To qualify, the ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:
Experienced with AWS Solution Components
Proficiency in building, deploying and orchestrating Docker containers
Experience in API design and development
Proficient in one or more scripting languages, including Python
Experience with version control management tools, preferably GitLab
Knowledge of structured file formats is required, eg JSON and HL7
Experience with workflow languages
Experience working with a relational database, preferably PL/SQL
Requires MS (preferred) or BS degree in engineering, life science, computer science, or related discipline.
BS with 5+ years or MS with 2-3 years of professional software development or technical engineering experience in an industrial or academic setting.
Experience in life sciences and bioinformatics is a strong plus.
Apply Today
Join us for competitive benefits and development opportunities in a progressive and supportive environment. Help us improve our service, and the experiences of our patients and colleagues. Work with us and together we can be better.
Your Quest career. Seek it out.
All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity or Citizenship.
